intro: Seriphidium assurgens, commonly known as the desert sandthrift, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, branched stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is well adapted to hot, dry climates. Its small, yellowish to white flowers bloom in the spring, and it produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Seriphidium assurgens is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ability to thrive in harsh conditions.
